page.title: 16SWANSCOMBE MAN
page.content: Barnfield Pit is world famous as the site in which the oldest human remains in Europe were found in 1935.The skull,which was in three pieces, is probably a woman's skull over 250,000 years old. In 1985 50th anniversary celebrations were held and several thousand people saw Magnus Magnusson unveil three plaques to commemorate the discovery. Barnfield Pit is a dis-used gravel pit that was formerly owned by Blue Circle until 1954 when it was given to the Nature Conservancy Council. The pit became a rubbish dump and a play area for local children - it has now been cleared and transformed into a nature reserve. On July 1st 1985 hundreds of local school children were taken to see this historic site of anthropological and archaeological importance.
